forum.name: Reflecting on Session 3.3
forum.intro:
In Session 3.3, you worked with multiple representations and strategies related to fractions. These experiences help us understand the different ways learners can approach fractions, beyond the procedural algorithms commonly used to solve problems. We can build from conceptual approaches to fractions to eventually connect to procedural algorithms. Connecting different representations helps learners see the “how” and “why” of a procedural algorithm. This process builds learners’ conceptual and procedural knowledge of fractions.

What are 1–2 things you are taking away from the Session 3.3 activities focusing on multiple representations of fractions? Click ADD DISCUSSION TOPIC to share your thoughts in the discussion forum below.

Remember to read and respond to others’ postings. (Click “Discuss this topic” on an individual post, then click “Reply” to respond to that post.)
